summary: Commercial drones are flying further distances, including for package delivery and public safety operations. But existing technologies don’t allow for two-way communication between drones and other aircraft, which could help avoid potential collisions. The Federal Aviation Administration proposed rules in 2025 that would require drones to be able to detect and avoid other aircraft. However, FAA has not identified further actions to help move toward...
title: Transforming Aviation: FAA Planning Efforts Should Address How Drones Will Communicate with and Avoid Other Aircraft
